Sentencas: An innovative combination of a two-stage alkali metal thermoelectric converter (TAMTEC), and thermally regenerative electrical cycle (TREC) is employed to utilize the high-quality heat dissipated from solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) for further electricity production.
Titulo: Novel hybrid two-stage alkali metal thermoelectric converter and thermally regenerative electrochemical cycle to exploit waste heat of solid oxide fuel cell: Performance assessment and optimization

Sentencas: The superiority and effectiveness of the SOFC-TAMTEC-TREC system are verified compared to existing SOFC-based hybrid systems and sole SOFC.
Titulo: Novel hybrid two-stage alkali metal thermoelectric converter and thermally regenerative electrochemical cycle to exploit waste heat of solid oxide fuel cell: Performance assessment and optimization

Sentencas: The performance of the system based on energy, exergy, and economic indicators is evaluated by varying the main design parameters.
Titulo: Novel hybrid two-stage alkali metal thermoelectric converter and thermally regenerative electrochemical cycle to exploit waste heat of solid oxide fuel cell: Performance assessment and optimization

Sentencas: Parametric assessment demonstrates that the SOFC-TAMTEC-TREC system can reach the maximum power density of 12126 W m(-2) with energy and exergy efficiencies of 47.13% and 50.46% as TAMTEC proportional constant increases to 10(7.5) m(2) and rising SOFC pore and gain diameters to 3.77 x 10(-6) m and 2.5 x 10(-6) m, respectively reduce the cost rate density of system by 3.55 $ h(-1) m(-2).
Titulo: Novel hybrid two-stage alkali metal thermoelectric converter and thermally regenerative electrochemical cycle to exploit waste heat of solid oxide fuel cell: Performance assessment and optimization

Sentencas: Furthermore, to achieve the maximum power density and exergy efficiency, and minimum cost rate density, NSGA-III multi-criteria optimization, and decision-making techniques are conducted.
Titulo: Novel hybrid two-stage alkali metal thermoelectric converter and thermally regenerative electrochemical cycle to exploit waste heat of solid oxide fuel cell: Performance assessment and optimization

Sentencas: Outcomes indicate that Shannon entropy leads to the maximum power density of 8597.2 W m(-2) with a 35.94% enhancement relative to a single SOFC and 1 $ h(-1) m(-2) increment in cost rate density of the hybrid system, while LINMAP and TOPSIS ascertain the minimum increase in the cost rate density by 0.6 $ h(-1) m(-2) with 31.04% improvement in power density relative to single SOFC.
Titulo: Novel hybrid two-stage alkali metal thermoelectric converter and thermally regenerative electrochemical cycle to exploit waste heat of solid oxide fuel cell: Performance assessment and optimization
